summary: This guide aims to assist users in creating a more stable and performance friendly modded skyrim experience.
descriptionHtml:
Introduction : This guide is my attempt to create a more 'up to date' version of other stability guides and to assist new and veteran users with the two main issues that can occur when modding skyrim - stability and performance.This guide will outline some of the key ways in which you can reduce CTDS and possibly increase fps.

This guide will be presented in the following format - i will link two videos ; one will consist of a longer and more detailed tutorial of the specified tool / mod and the other will be a shorter and less detailed tutorial for those who don't like to watch longer videos. I will also write out a step by step guide as well.

[size=5][b][u]Prerequisites:[/u][/b]
[/size][size=4][b]Extraction Tools[/b] (choose one)
[/size]
7ZIP covers a wider range of available extensions in which it can compress / extract, but install whichever you would like. 
[u] [/u][size=2][b]- Winrar [/b]can be found here - [url=https://www.rarlab.com/download.htm?]https://www.rarlab.com/download.htm?[/url] - If you have a 64 bit operating system install x64 for Winrar else install x86 for 32 bit systems.
[b] - 7ZIP [/b]can be found here - [url=https://www.7-zip.org/download.html]https://www.7-zip.org/download.html[/url] - If you have a 64 bit operating system install  x64 (either exe or zip file) else install x86 for 32 bit systems.

[/size][b][size=4]Mod Manager[/size][/b]  [size=4](Choose one)[/size]

Mod organizer is my personal preference as it handles skyrim's data folder in a more stability friendly way.
Mod organizer 2 can also be used for skyrim , however i use mod organizer 2 for special edition only as i personally run into some problems when using it with legacy edition skyrim.
Nexus Mod Manager : More consistently updated however does not have a virtual data structure so it interferes with the vanilla data's folder.
Wrye Bash : I personally i have not used this, however i use Wrye bash for bashed patches (later on in guide) so i cannot critic it's capability.

[size=3][u]Downloads :[/u][/size]

 - [b]Mod Organize[/b]r can be found here - [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1334/]https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1334/[/url]
 - [b]Mod Organizer 2[/b] can be found here - [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/6194]https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/6194
[/url] - [b]Nexus Mod Manager[/b] can be found here - [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/modmanager/]https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/modmanager/[/url]
 - [b]Wrye bash[/b] can be found here - [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1840/]https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1840/[/url]﻿

[size=3][u]Videos :[/u]

Detailed :
[/size] - [b]Mod Organizer Detailed Install Video[/b] can be found here - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OHgULB431Os]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OHgULB431Os[/url]
 - [b]Mod Organizer 2 Detailed Install Video[/b] can be found here - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DG3eqyNOByw]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DG3eqyNOByw[/url]﻿
 - [b]Nexus Mod Manager Detailed Install Video[/b] can be found here - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVC31Qu048Q]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVC31Qu048Q
[/url] - [b]Wrye Bash Detailed Install Video[/b] can be found here - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wkmTZP1SyIA - Follow install instructions and ignore mod organizer related instructions (if using Wrye bash as a standalone mod manager)
[size=3]
[/size][size=3]Shorter :
[/size] - [b]Mod Organizer Shorter Install Video[/b] can be found here - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I-yJ_9uBUBQ]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I-yJ_9uBUBQ[/url]﻿
 - [b]Nexus Mod Manager Shorter Install Video[/b] can be found here - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6EWEOrDBwIQ]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6EWEOrDBwIQ
 
[/url]
[b][u][size=5]Mods / Tools:[/size][/u][/b]
[size=4][b][u]SKSE / SKSE 64
[/u][/b][/size] - [b]SKSE [/b]is a tool which extends the capabilities of skyrim's modding capabilities and is required in order for multiple mods to work.
 - [b]SKSE [/b]can be found here - [url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]http://skse.silverlock.org/[/url]﻿
 - [b]SKSE Detailed Install Video[/b] can be found here - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PKW3fc5MFRE]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PKW3fc5MFRE[/url]﻿
 - [b]SKSE Shorter Install Video [/b]can be found here - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wvcy-l00GXU]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wvcy-l00GXU[/url]﻿
[b][size=4]Written Guide :[/size][/b]
[b][size=3]Mod Organizer :[/size][/b]
 1 - Download SKSE 7zip or SKSE64 7zip - Special edition current build is 2.0.7 and Legacy edition current build is 1.7.3.
 2 - Once downloaded, extract the contents of the folder to your desktop or a desired location. You should then have a folder titled skse_1_07_03 (for legacy edition) or skse64_2_00_07 (for Special Edition).
 3 - Delete all files with the extension .txt although i suggest you browse over them before hand for viewing changelogs and readmes.
 4 - Copy these files - skse_1_9_32.dll, skse_loader.exe and skse_steam_loader.dll. The src folder can also be copied as it can be used for creation kit functions.
 5 - Paste these 3 / 4 items into your skyrim root directory NOT the data folder. - normally located in 
      - Program files (x86) / steam / steamapps  / common / skyrim
 6 - Now, you must have previously launched mod organizer in order for it to setup the necessary files so if you haven't done that already do so now. 
 7 - Go to the 'mods' folder inside mod organizer, although this location changes depending on where you installed mod organizer to. - normally located in
      - Program files (x86) / steam / steamapps  / common / skyrim / Mod Organizer / mods
 8 - Create a new folder and name it something relevant such as 'SKSE' or 'SKSE Scripts' , then go back to your extracted skse folder and go into the data folder, then copy the 'scripts' folder and paste into the newly created skse folder inside mod organizer's mod folder.

[b][u][size=4]ENBoost
[/size][/u][/b] - Enboost is used to reduce RAM usage to avoid reaching the 3.1gb of memory cap - Gopher Video - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LyTDCCCYuZk]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LyTDCCCYuZk[/url]


[b][u][size=4]TES5EDIT / SSEEDIT 
[/size][/u][/b] - TES5Edit / SSEEdit is a tool which has multiple functions but the main ones being - conflict analysis , cleaning mods and creating merged patches

[size=3][u]Downloads :[/u][/size]
 - [b]TES5Edit[/b]  can be found here - [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25859/]https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25859/[/url]
 - [b]SSEEdit[/b] can be found here - [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/164/]https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/164/[/url]﻿
[size=3][u]Videos :[/u]
Detailed:
[/size] - TES5Edit Detailed Install Video can be found here - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2F19Do8HAl4]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2F19Do8HAl4[/url]
 - SSEEdit Detailed Install Video can be found here - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TXYES4hNsvM]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TXYES4hNsvM[/url]

Shorter:
 - TES5Edit Shorter Install Video can be found here - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s3FZ4bMTWgQ]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s3FZ4bMTWgQ[/url]
 - SSEEdit Shorter Install Video can be found here - [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PqR1Gx7p2KM]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PqR1Gx7p2KM[/url]
(this is an install through mod organizer , should work the same for mod organizer 2 , unfortunately i couldn't find any short install videos for SSEEdit, if anyone comes across any please feel free to share in the post section).
author: dovakiindragonbornlord
